quotes.speaker: Ben Carter
quotes.quote: So every time I’m left at risk, it proves safeguarding doesn’t exist for me.

quotes.speaker: Emma Veritas
quotes.quote: I understand, Ben, and I’ve told them that safeguarding must apply equally.

quotes.speaker: Ben Carter
quotes.quote: But it hasn’t, and that makes me an exception to the law.

quotes.speaker: Emma Veritas
quotes.quote: You’re right, it hasn’t been applied equally in your case.

quotes.speaker: Ben Carter
quotes.quote: So I’m excluded from rights everyone else has.

quotes.speaker: Emma Veritas
quotes.quote: I know, and that’s deeply wrong.

contradictions.issue: Victim excluded from safeguarding rights; advocate admits inequality but no correction
